snippet: At Resorts World Casino, where employees’ average pay doubled last year, a buffet restaurant that recently increased its prices has now closed.
abstract: Buffet restaurant in Resorts World Casino in Ozone Park, Queens, closes, with 175 workers losing their jobs; casino had received praise in late October of 2013 when a labor arbitrator issued a ruling that doubled employees' average pay; New York Hotel Trades Council, union representing the buffet workers, hopes to negotiate with owner Genting Group for other jobs at the casino.
lead_paragraph: At Resorts World Casino, where employees’ average pay doubled last year, a buffet restaurant that recently increased its prices has now closed.

headline.main: After Winning a Raise, 175 Casino Workers in Queens Lose Their Jobs
headline.print_headline: After Winning a Raise, 175 Casino Workers in Queens Lose Their Jobs
